transcripts.text: I actually got to talking with a couple atheists online, and I have some questions for the atheists out there, and also some challenges toward the end of this video that I'm going to throw out for evolutionists.

Of course, they weren't real questions.  The ones asking them, usually Christians, didn't really want to know anything.  They were gotcha questions, or what they thought were gotcha questions, designed as attempts to refute atheism, or at least to make it look ridiculous.  This guy isn't much different, and he even says that these are rhetorical questions designed to make us think, so he probably doesn't care what the answers are, but I'm gonna answer them anyway.  Like I said, I miss questions for atheist videos.

And so my question to you guys is, including Auryn Ra, is why... Why are you guys so focused on Christianity?

You guys are the ones who actually affect our lives.  That's why.  That should have been a well duh answer to a question that doesn't even need to be asked.  But we're not just focused on Christianity.  Most YouTube atheists will address other religions too.

I'm not going around telling people who believe in Bigfoot, UFOs, and the Loch Ness Monster that they're full of crap.  Ask yourself why not.  What's different about them?  Answer, they're not actively making my life worse because of their beliefs.  I don't have to debunk their crapola because they're not shoving it down everybody else's throats.  They're just kooks, not kooks who think that the world belongs to them and everybody else has to fall in line or else.
I truly do care for you guys, and I want you to be honest with yourselves and ask yourself this question.
And I want you to think about my answers, but I don't expect it.
If you are truly atheist, you truly do not believe God exists, then why dedicate your whole lives, your whole YouTube channel, to fighting Christianity?
